solution_line_template: The plant supplier earned ${orchid_price} x {orchid_qty} = $<<{orchid_price}*{orchid_qty}={orchid_earnings}>>{orchid_earnings} for the orchids.
He earned ${money_plant_price} x {money_plant_qty} = $<<{money_plant_price}*{money_plant_qty}={money_plant_earnings}>>{money_plant_earnings} for the potted Chinese money plants.
Then he paid ${worker_pay} x {num_workers} = $<<{worker_pay}*{num_workers}={total_worker_pay}>>{total_worker_pay} to his workers.
He used a total of ${total_worker_pay} + ${pots_cost} = $<<{total_worker_pay}+{pots_cost}={total_expenses}>>{total_expenses} for the worker's pay and new pots.
Hence, he was left with ${total_earnings} - ${total_expenses} = $<<{money_left}={money_left}>>{money_left} from his earnings.
